page.title: 10LOCAL EMPLOYMENT 2
page.content: {West Devon and North Cornwall Farmers (W.D.N.C.F.) was formed in 1919 by a group of local farmers at Holsworthy to supply agricultural needs to the area.By 1965 (W.D.N.C.F.) had expanded to cover the whole West Devon,North Cornwall area with eight offices in different towns. The head office is in Holsworthy employing 110 people plus 2 persons on the Youth Training Scheme. The qualifications needed range from a sales diploma to two O Levels. Since 1979 the company accounts has been fully computerised for speed and efficiency. 95% of (W.D.N.C.F.) animal feed is produced at Holsworthy and Launceston in their own mills,90 tonnes a day is produced.In 1984 the company had a loss due to milk quotas because farmers were not buying as much animal feed.
